objectives: Evaluate evidence and reasoning about news consumption

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about news consumption
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about news consumption
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of news consumption
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to news consumption
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about news consumption
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss news consumption
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to news consumption
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to news consumption

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about news consumption
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about news consumption
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about news consumption

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Quiet space with good acoustics and audio equipment

warm_up.description: Students listen to audio about news consumption and share reactions

main_activities.description: Students receive information about news consumption through auditory modality
Students practice language related to news consumption using auditory approach
Students produce original content about news consumption demonstrating advanced thinking

discussion_prompts: What are the implications of news consumption for society?
How would you design a better approach to news consumption?
What criteria would you use to evaluate news consumption?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for news consumption
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to news consumption

homework_options.required: Core assignment at advanced level using auditory approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about news consumption
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
